sections.title: What Is a Digital Signature Certificate Online?
sections.text: A digital signature certificate online is another name for a DSC or ID. The authority should have an active digital certificate in order to sign official documents digitally. A certificate authority will issue a digital certificate. One can either buy a Digital Signature Certificate online or apply digital signature online from third party certificate authorities. Additionally, a lot of organisations, governments, and businesses can publish their own certifications. In order to use a digital signature it is mandatory to have a dsc registration. Digital signatures are made feasible by digital certificates.
The digital signature registration certificate is used to identify and verify the identity of individuals holding and using this signature. It is also used like a secure digital key.

Public key encryptions are used in digital signatures to produce the signatures. Along with the user's name, other information including the pin code email address, the date on which the certificate issued and the name of the certifying authority will be included in the digital signature certificate.

Encrypt DSC: This type of dsc registration is widely used to protect a document. It is used to encrypt a document and is used in tender portals to help businesses that focus on uploading their papers.

Encrypt and Sign: Both signing and encrypting may be done using the Sign & Encrypt DSC. It is apt for users who wish to uphold the privacy of shared information and authenticate the same. It is used for submitting applications and forms to the government.

items.question: How does a Digital signature Certificate (DSC) For Signing Online Work?
items.answer: An electronic document issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) is a digital certificate. This denotes all the Identity linked with the key including organisation name and a public key for primary digital signature. It is used to prove that the public key belongs exclusively to a specific company that is provided the required certificate to utilise the same.

items.question: Who is authorised to provide a digital signature certificate online?
items.answer: Only Certifying Authorities are issued certificates by the Office of Controller of Certifying Authorities (CCA) (CAs). End-entities receive Digital Signature Certificates from CAs.

items.question: Can I get a DSC registration for nothing?
items.answer: You may also obtain a digital signature certificate for free by visiting websites like Free DSC if you are willing to spend roughly ₹750 on a USB token to store it.

items.answer: ₹750 (Inclusive of 4 % Sales Tax). Any additional taxes that may apply.

items.question: Can one hold a certain number of DSC Registration?
items.answer: It is apt for a single person to use one digital signature certificate for both business and personal purposes.

items.question: What distinguishes a digital certificate from a digital signature?
items.answer: In the real world the digital signature certificate technically connects a digital signature to a particular organisation or an individual to ensure data and other crucial information is safe from the moment it is issued.

items.question: What is the duration of validity of  Digital signature Certificate (DSC) For Signing Online?
items.answer: Typically, DSCs are provided with a one-year or two-year validity period. Upon expiration of the initial issuance period, these are renewed.

items.question: Why is DSC Registration required?
items.answer: To guarantee the veracity, integrity, and privacy of the data, a Digital Signature Certificate (DSC) is necessary when digitally signing computer papers and deals.

items.question: Who issues the Digital Signature Certificate Online?
items.answer: A DSC is issued by a Certifying Authority (CA), which is authorised by the Controller of Certifying Authorities (CCA) under the Information Technology Act, 2000.

items.question: Is MCA e-filing possible if I don't have a DSC Registration?
items.answer: MCA e-filing is not possible without a DSC, as it is mandatory for companies and LLPs to file various documents and forms with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) using a valid DSC.

items.question: Is there any validity of the Digital Signature Certificate?
items.answer: Yes, the validity of a Digital Signature Certificate ranges from 1 to 3 years, depending on the type of certificate and the policy of the certifying authority that issues it.

items.question: Is it possible to make changes to the DSC while renewing it?
items.answer: No, changes cannot be made to the DSC while renewing it. If any changes need to be made, a new DSC must be obtained.

items.question: Can a person have two Digital Signature Registration?
items.answer: Yes, a person can have more than one DSC, but each DSC must be used for a specific purpose or role.

items.question: What is the time required for obtaining the DSC Registration in India?
items.answer: The time required for obtaining a DSC in India depends on the CA that issues it, but it typically takes a few days to a week to obtain a DSC.

items.question: Can one authorise someone to use DSC?
items.answer: Yes, a person can authorise another person to use their DSC by providing a digital authorisation letter or by sharing the private key of the DSC.

items.question: Who needs Class 3 DSC?
items.answer: Class 3 DSC is required for e-tendering, e-procurement, and other high-security online transactions that require a high level of assurance and authentication.

items.question: What is an e-Pass Token?
items.answer: An e-Pass Token is a USB-based device that stores the digital signature certificate and private key, which can be used to digitally sign documents and transactions. It provides an additional layer of security by storing the certificate and key offline.

items.question: Why is Digital Signature Registration required in filing income tax?
items.answer: A DSC is required in filing income tax to ensure the authenticity and security of the electronic documents being filed.

items.question: Do the taxpayers need to register digital signature certificate again in the new e-Filing portal?
items.answer: Yes, taxpayers need to register their DSC again in the new e-Filing portal to continue using it for filing income tax returns.

items.question: What type of Digital Signature Certificate (DSC) is to be obtained for e-Filing on the MCA Portal?
items.answer: A Class 2 or Class 3 DSC is required for e-filing on the MCA portal, depending on the type of transaction and level of security required.

items.question: Do I need to be physically present for verification of my identity?
items.answer: Depending on the certifying authority and the type of DSC, physical presence may be required for identity verification during the DSC application process.

items.question: Is Digital Signature available in Soft Copy?
items.answer: Yes, a digital signature can be available in soft copy format, but it must be stored securely and protected by a password or other security measures to prevent unauthorised access.
